children.subject: I can't p/np I gotta take it for a letter grade to graduate or either I could take 2 tech electives and one tech and p/np it? huh maybee
have u taken it without the prereqs?
you can p/np it worst case. you'll learn a lot of great things!

history.content:
Firstly - congratulations on your upcoming graduation next semester! 

As someone who graduated recently, I'd definitely agree with you - your last semester should really be a chance for you to try all the things you never did before (because of time, work, etc), and taking 189 is a fantastic idea! In a two-tech semester, 189 and (186/Data 100) won't be too bad at all (especially Data 100, because of the overlaps in material), and I've taken the class with Prof. Shewchuk - he's easily the best professor I've had, an extremely well-organized and clear lecturer.

I personally loved the class (made me change track from pure software engineering to a ML-oriented career), and think you should defo go for it - Prof. Shewchuk does review the material you'll need pretty quickly, and there are some great resources out there to look up the material (plus the homeworks will definitely help you get a grasp on some of the pre-req material you might not have take).

Side note, would also strongly encourage you to take classes in other non-CS departments that sound interesting - there are a lot of great departments at Cal (CS included, of course), and the final semester is a great chance to branch out into some of them you never got to explore before (whether it's a science, or a humanities, or even just a 1/2 unit PE class!)

children.subject: As far as prereqs go, my main question would be:  how well do you understand linear algebra?  I mean really understand it visually and geometrically, and not just as symbol manipulation?  That's probably what will make the biggest difference between a fun semester and a struggle.

history.content:
it's my final semester, and I kinda have a dumb idea to take 189 even though all my friends pretty much are telling me not to, I'm weaker at math, and I kind of understand why but I also feel like I'm not gonna have this chance again and shewchuk is teaching the class! I haven't taken 53 but I have taken 54, and I took 70 but I haven't taken 126 or 127. I was thinking maybe I could self study prerequisite knowledge but I also know I'm pretty bad at self-studying.

I wanna take data 100, cs186, cs189 and I need a tech elective to graduate.

I think I really wanna take cs186 and cs189 but do you think the workload would be a lot? how much would it compare to other techs? So I think it might be easier to do data100 and cs189 since they have some overlap. 

Usually I take two tech electives a year. If I take three it's usually because they're lighter. 

So I'm either thinking data 100/186 and cs189, data 100 and cs186, or data100/cs186 and ee126/math110/ee127. Or some class to give me better math background so after graduation if I wanna approach these topics it'd be less intimidating. 

I don't think I'll be doing any ml research and just going into industry after graduation, but I think this could be a cool opportunity to learn things I could do best in the structured environment of school. Maybe I'm approaching this all the wrong way though and I wouldn't get much out of 189 because I'd be overwhelmed.
history.subject: should I take 189?
